action.action-desc: Mr. Schumer (for himself and Mr. Crapo) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to allow physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and clinical nurse specialists to supervise cardiac, intensive cardiac, and pulmonary rehabilitation programs.

section.header: Allowing physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and clinical nurse specialists to supervise cardiac, intensive cardiac, and pulmonary rehabilitation programs

subsection.header: Cardiac and intensive cardiac rehabilitation programs
subsection.text: Section 1861(eee) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(eee)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting under the supervision of a physician (as defined in subsection (r)(1)) or a physician assistant, nurse practitioner, or clinical nurse specialist (as those terms are defined in subsection (aa)(5)) before the period at the end;
in subparagraph (A)(iii), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and

in subparagraph (B), by striking a physician and inserting a physician (as defined in subsection (r)(1)) or a physician assistant, nurse practitioner, or clinical nurse specialist (as those terms are defined in subsection (aa)(5)); and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4)(A), in the matter preceding clause (i)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting under the supervision of a physician (as defined in subsection (r)(1)) or a physician assistant, nurse practitioner, or clinical nurse specialist (as those terms are defined in subsection (aa)(5)) after paragraph (3).

subsection.text: Section 1861(fff)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(fff)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting under the supervision of a physician (as defined in subsection (r)(1)) or a physician assistant, nurse practitioner, or clinical nurse specialist (as those terms are defined in subsection (aa)(5)) before the period at the end.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to items and services furnished on or after the date that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
